title: Morristown National Historical Park: Passport Stamps
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Passport Stamps              National Park Passport Stamps       The Passport program was started by Eastern National Parks Association in 1986 and was established to help visitors discover the beauty and history found in America's national parks. Cancellation stamps can be found at national parks and monuments. These rubber-stamp ink markings record the name of the park and the date of your visit.  Morristown National Historical Park was the Mid-Atlantic Region stamp on the 2003 Passport Stamp set.  Where can you find passport stamps at Morristown? The information below details our currently available stamps:         Morristown National Historical Park Location: This passport stamp is located at the museum store desk at the Washington's Headquarters Musem during normal operating hours.         Crossroads of the American Revolution NHA Location: This passport stamp is located at the museum store desk at the Washington's Headquarters Museum and the front desk of the Jockey Hollow Visitor Center during normal operating hours.         Morristown NHP Jockey Hollow Location: This passport stamp is located at the front desk of the Jockey Hollow Visitor Center during normal operating hours.
